==Sources of Wisdom==
 
==Sources of Wisdom==
−
Beyond the simple expedient of experience (which may be considered the most difficult way to gain wisdom as through the "school of hard knocks"), there are a variety of other avenues to gaining wisdom which vary according to different philosophies. For example, [[Freethought|Freethinkers]] and others believe that wisdom may come from pure [[reason]], which others believe that it comes from [[intuition]] or [[spirituality]].
+
Beyond the simple expedient of experience (which may be considered the most difficult way to gain wisdom as through the "school of hard knocks"), there are a variety of other avenues to gaining wisdom which vary according to different philosophies. For example, [[Freethought|Freethinkers]] and others believe that wisdom may come from pure [[reason]] and perhaps experience, while others believe that it comes from [[intuition]] or [[spirituality]].
     
* Traditional western culture associates wisdom with [[virtue]]. For example, in the [[Roman Catholic]] church, wisdom ([[prudence]]) stands with [[justice]], [[fortitude]] and [[moderation]] as one of the four [[cardinal virtues]]. The source of these virtues was [[Plato]].
 
* Traditional western culture associates wisdom with [[virtue]]. For example, in the [[Roman Catholic]] church, wisdom ([[prudence]]) stands with [[justice]], [[fortitude]] and [[moderation]] as one of the four [[cardinal virtues]]. The source of these virtues was [[Plato]].
